image.altText: A crowd gathers outside a gate while several people try to break through the gate

props.synopsis: Fifteen people have died in violent unrest and riots in Papua New Guinea after some residents took advantage of police being on strike to set shops and businesses alight in the capital.

title.children: 15 people dead in PNG after a payroll dispute left an opening for rioting and unrest

image.altText: A doctor holds a stethoscope in two clasped hands

props.synopsis: A GP accused of raping his patient in a pub toilet has been cleared of allegations of professional misconduct and found to have "no case to answer".

title.children: GP who says he didn't recognise patient before sex cleared of allegations of professional misconduct

image.altText: Composite of a man and a bullet hole in a glass door.

props.synopsis: The man shot dead by police on a street in Nowra yesterday has been identified as 34-year-old Alexander Stuart Pinnock, known to authorities after pleading guilty to offences relating to unqualified legal practice last year.

title.children: Fake lawyer Alexander Pinnock identified as gunman killed by police at Nowra medical centre

image.altText: A woman with a neutral expression looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: As Ukrainian authorities consider another mobilisation to bolster military ranks as it fights a Russian invasion, young men are already hard to find in the village of Krasnopillia, and it's a similar story around the country.

title.children: In Ukraine, war is causing new consequences: men are missing

image.altText: Jigalong Remote Community School

props.synopsis: Three nurses have been rushed out of the remote WA community of Jigalong, sparking calls for preventative steps to be taken to tackle youth crime.

title.children: Remote community left with single nurse after alleged break-in attempt

image.altText: Alex de Minaur clenches his fist during a US Open match against Daniil Medvedev.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur will play former world number three Milos Raonic in a difficult opening match for the Aussie star, as the Australian Open gets underway on Sunday.

title.children: Aussie star Alex de Minaur cops brutal opening round match ahead of Sunday's Australian Open

image.altText: the back of a man with a mask on on  acargo ship

props.synopsis: The vote was 11-0 in favour of the resolution, with Russia, China, Algeria and Mozambique abstaining.

title.children: UN Security Council demands halt to Houthi attacks on Red Sea shipping route

image.altText: Man in screengrab behind bars

props.synopsis: The Vladimir Putin foe serving a 19-year sentence on charges of extremism, appears in court from the remote Arctic penal colony where he was sent in December.

title.children: Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny cracks jokes in first appearance since Arctic jail transfer

image.altText: three adults, a child and two dogs pose for a santa photo

props.synopsis: Sydney, Canberra and Melbourne have long been touted as Australia's most expensive cities when it comes to property, but after three years of a COVID-19-bolstered boom, Brisbane has climbed the ranks.

title.children: To afford a home in the city they loved the Deacon family thought outside the box. They haven't looked back

image.altText: Clayton Oliver looks dejected

props.synopsis: Melbourne gun Clayton Oliver is on extended leave as he deals with personal issues and has not returned to AFL preseason training with his teammates.

title.children: Demons star misses preseason due to 'personal issues'

image.altText: A composite image of an Israeli tank next to a set of blue scales.

props.synopsis: International law experts say South Africa's genocide case against Israel could put political pressure on Israel and its allies, forcing a change of tactics in the Gaza war.

title.children: Could the genocide case against Israel have an impact on the war in Gaza?

image.altText: An empty beach leads to a heavy industrial area with large smoke plumes

props.synopsis: The chief executive of a peak body says the Kwinana industrial area in Perth's south must undergo drastic change if it is to meet state government emissions targets.

title.children: It's an industrial precinct that contributes $15 billion into WA's economy, but what lies in store for Kwinana?

image.altText: Four police officers stand behind twelve men seated on a set of stairs.

props.synopsis: Ecuador is reeling from a fresh wave of violence that has shaken the South American nation, with the president launching a military crackdown after criminal groups took more than 100 prison staff hostage and gunmen stormed a live television broadcast.

title.children: Ecuador's president says the country is at war with 'terrorist groups'. What's causing the unrest?

image.altText: Water covers a country road. The road is surrounded by thick, green bushland

props.synopsis: The clean-up has begun for many Victorians affected by flooding this week, but others are still waiting to return home as the water slowly recedes.

title.children: Above-floor flooding not expected in Victorian towns of Mooroopna, Shepparton

image.altText: Two large gold coins bearing engraved "b"s lie on top of a complex financial line-and-bar graph

props.synopsis: Interest rate sensitive sectors such as discretionary retail, real estate and banking are leading the ASX higher, while Bitcoin climbs after the US regulator approves a number of exchange-traded funds. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX gains as interest rate sensitive sectors bounce, US regulator approves Bitcoin ETFs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia will follow and approve crypto ETFs, expert says
Why some aren't celebrating the historic US crypto decision
Why some shoppers think supermarket 'prices are crap'

image.altText: An abandoned house with graffiti

props.synopsis: In an outback town suffering crippling building shortages and an overloaded social housing system, dozens of abandoned properties are like a slap in the face to those in need of a home.

title.children: Abandoned houses too expensive to repair 'a disease' on outback Queensland mining city in housing crisis

image.altText: Alex de Minaur smiles

props.synopsis: Everything you need to know ahead of the 2024 Australian Open getting underway on Sunday as Alex de Minaur flies the flag for Australia and Novak Djokovic shoots for history.

title.children: Everything you need to know ahead of the 2024 Australian Open

image.altText: Collage of The Crown, Barbie and Succession stills

props.synopsis: Australians Margot Robbie, Sarah Snook, and Elizabeth Debicki are all nominated for Screen Actors Guild awards.

title.children: Barbie and Succession take out top nods for 2024 SAG Awards

image.altText: A TV still of Alaqua Cox, a Native American actor in her mid-20s, looking tough. She is wearing a backpack and large boots.

props.synopsis: In Echo, the first Marvel TV show to be led by an Indigenous cast, the antihero from the Hawkeye series returns to her roots.

title.children: How Marvel's new series puts First Nations culture at its centre

image.altText: An aerial shot of two cars hit by a truck, one completely crushed, and emergency services walking on scene.

props.synopsis: Police say three other vehicles were damaged when a truck collided with a car, killing the driver, in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man dead, multiple vehicles damaged after truck hits car in Melbourne's south-east, police say

image.altText: New NT prison

props.synopsis: Advocates are calling for changes to the NT prison system as inmate numbers continue to soar, and after two incidents in two weeks at the Alice Springs Correctional Centre.

title.children: 'We are locking them up': More than 40 per cent of NT prison population on remand

image.altText: Tamiko Gleeson and her husband Daniel stand in an empty room under construction. They hold their dog and smile at the camera

props.synopsis: There's nothing like a renovation to throw your life into disarray, but it can be a new level of chaos while also living in your home. These are the nuggets of wisdom for how to survive, from those who've done it .

title.children: These couples chose to live without kitchens or bathrooms, all in the name of renovating. Here's what they learned

image.altText: Arms holding a book against a blue sky, surrounded by field of high grass.

props.synopsis: Do you think reading fiction is purely for pleasure? These experts explain why there's a whole lot more to gain, in your personal life and at work, from picking up a book.

title.children: 'We don't have time to not do it': Why this expert says reading makes you a better worker

image.altText: A woman and a young man.

props.synopsis: Robyn Brewin's son suffered a catastrophic brain injury following a one-punch attack. He lives in a group home but that could change following NDIS funding cuts.

title.children: Family of one-punch victim fights removal of NDIS funding for 24-hour nurse at Melbourne disability home

image.altText: three men in black shirts looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Police will allege the arrested men were linked to a well-known crime syndicate, and had been taking on contract work to carry out murders.

title.children: ONEFOUR rappers allegedly targeted in foiled murder plot

image.altText: The mouth of a woman with two fake gold teeth.

props.synopsis: Dentists in Fiji say unlicensed operators are providing cosmetic dentistry services using phoney false teeth and imitation dental jewellery that can corrode and become toxic in people's mouths.

title.children: Fijian dentists warn cheap dental work leaving people with 'gum tissue burnt, lips stuck together'

image.altText: Burning bush next to a fire break

props.synopsis: From detecting smoke rising from timber plantations to scanning bushwalkers' photos to assess fuel loads, artificial intelligence is becoming an essential part of protecting the nation's forests.

title.children: AI is keeping watch day and night to help protect Australia's forests from bushfires

image.altText: A close-up of Hunter Biden, sitting between people in a committee room, wearing a suit and tie and crossing his arms

props.synopsis: The son of US President Joe Biden makes an unannounced visit to Capitol Hill, stirring a political frenzy as Republicans call for him to be held in contempt of Congress.

title.children: Hunter Biden's surprise appearance at his own contempt hearing leads to shouting match in US Congress

image.altText: Elon Musk Twitter account is seen in this illustration.

props.synopsis: The eSafety commissioner says the social media platform's hate-monitoring practices are "jaw-dropping" after it reinstated thousands of banned Australian accounts.

title.children: Online safety regulator accuses Elon Musk's X of adding fuel to a fire of online hate

image.altText: Wide shot of three turbine floating on top of the water with two boats

props.synopsis: Despite concerns about harms to marine life posed by wind turbines, experts say they can create new marine habitats.

title.children: 'Like a shipwreck on a seabed': How wind turbines can become homes for marine life

props.synopsis: For two million years, Gigantopithecus blacki roamed the forests of what is now southern China. A new study claims to discover when — and why — it went extinct.

title.children: The story of 'Giganto', the world's largest ape, and why it disappeared forever
